subject: 1000 days of CPAN releases.
header:
Mohammad Anwar has done at least one CPAN release per day for the last 1000 days,
adopting a bunch of CPAN distributions along the way.
His passion for help CPAN and CPAN authors, is admirable!

Check out the list of talks for TPC::EU, which has now been finalised. And if you're going to TPC::EU, you could help out the EPO, if you're going to be there the day before the conference proper starts.

entries.author: dave_cross
entries.text: Dave needs images of traffic lights, for some secret squirrel project he's working on. He ended up creating SVG::TrafficLight, which makes it easy to draw SVG traffic lights.
entries.title: Drawing Traffic Lights With Perl

mohammad_anwar
entries.text: On Sunday 23rd July, Mohammad did a release to CPAN, making it the 1000th consecutive day that he'd done a CPAN release on. That's nearly 3 years (1095 days). In that time he's released a lot of his own modules, but has also got co-maint on a lot of others, and adopted some of those.
entries.title: 1000th consecutive days releasing to CPAN
